name: aws_disk_to_gcp
short_description: Copies EBS volumes from within AWS, and transfers them to GCP.
description: Copies EBS volumes from within AWS by pushing them to an AWS S3 bucket. The S3 bucket is then copied to a Google Cloud Storage bucket, from which a GCP Disk Image and fnially a GCP Persistent Disk are created. This operation happens in the cloud and doesn't touch the local workstation on which the recipe is run.
args: AWS region containing the EBS volumes.
Destination GCP zone in which to create the disks.
Comma separated list of EBS volume IDs (e.g. vol-xxxxxxxx).
AWS subnet to copy instances from, required if there is no default subnet in the volume region.
Run all Turbinia processing jobs instead of a faster subset.
Timesketch sketch to which the timeline should be added.
Optional custom password to decrypt Timesketch credential file with.
Whether to wait for Timesketch to finish processing all timelines.
